description: From Middle English antelope, from Old French antelop, from Medieval Latin antilops, from Byzantine Greek ἀνθόλοψ (anthólops).

entries.meaning: Any of several African mammals of the family Bovidae distinguished by hollow horns, which, unlike deer, they do not shed.

examples: "It reminds me of when I was hunting antelope in Colorado," he said to her.

entries.meaning: (archaic, mythology) A fierce legendary creature said to live on the banks of the Euphrates, having long serrated horns and being hard to catch.
